units.title: Construct metacells integrating transcriptome and chromatin accessibility
units.text: we integrated the two modalities by constructing metacells containing both transcriptome and chromatin accessibility information, defining a total of 24 clusters from 35,499 metacells (Fig. 4a and Supplementary Table 3).
units.rationale: This is an actionable protocol step for integrating multi-omic data into unified cell clusters.

units.title: Infer terminal macrostates and transition probabilities using CellRank
units.text: To follow cell trajectories over time, we used CellRank47 to infer the terminal macrostates (myocytic, epicardial, endothelial and endodermal) and the probability of each cell to transition toward these states based on both pseudotime and RNA velocity information (Fig. 4b and Extended Data Fig. 7a).
units.rationale: This describes a specific computational protocol for trajectory inference using a defined tool and parameters.

units.title: Generate hiPSC reporter line with FRT-flanked STOP-mKate2-HA
units.text: To functionally validate the fate potential of different progenitor populations in epicardioids, we generated an hiPSC reporter line in which a flippase (FLP) recognition target (FRT)-flanked neomycin cassette blocking transcription of a pCAG-driven fluorescent reporter (mKate2) fused to a hemagglutinin (HA) tag was knocked into the AAVS1 safe harbor locus49 (Supplementary Results and Supplementary Fig. 4a–f).
units.rationale: This is a precise genetic engineering protocol step for creating a lineage-tracing reporter line.

units.title: Transduce epicardioids with lentiviral FLP under CDH1 promoter
units.text: epicardioids from this reporter line were transduced with a lentiviral vector encoding FLP under the control of the CDH1 promoter at day 15 (Fig. 5a and Extended Data Fig. 9a).
units.rationale: This is a specific, timed experimental intervention to induce recombination in a defined cell population.

units.title: Apply 4-hydroxytamoxifen (4-OHT) to induce FLP activity during JCF stage
units.text: 4-hydroxytamoxifen (4-OHT) was applied at the beginning of the JCF stage (days 7–8; Fig. 4e and Extended Data Fig. 8a).
units.rationale: This is a timed, actionable chemical induction step to activate FLP recombinase in a specific developmental window.

units.title: Perform subclustering of epicardial lineage at day 15
units.text: We then exploited our metacell dataset to investigate the timing of epicardial fate decisions. For this, we performed subclustering of the epicardial lineage at day 15 (differentially expressed genes (DEGs) listed in Supplementary Table 6) and analyzed cell trajectories using CellRank.
units.rationale: This describes a specific bioinformatic protocol for refining cell type resolution within a lineage at a defined time point.

units.title: Analyze immunofluorescence for HA tag, cTnT, and vimentin at day 24
units.text: On day 24, immunofluorescence analysis revealed HA-tag+ SMCs and fibroblasts but also CMs (Fig. 5b, Supplementary Video 3 and Extended Data Fig. 9c), supporting the fate potentiality previously inferred from gene expression (Fig. 1h,i).
units.rationale: This is a direct experimental protocol step for validating lineage tracing via immunostaining at a specific time point.

units.title: Co-stain HA tag and ISL1 to confirm JCF labeling after 48 h
units.text: In the absence of a reliable antibody to MAB21L2, we performed co-staining of the HA tag and ISL1 after 48 h to confirm successful labeling of ISL1+ JCF cells located at the outer layer (Extended Data Fig. 8b).
units.rationale: This is a specific validation protocol using dual immunostaining to confirm targeted cell labeling.

units.title: Perform immunostaining of ISL1 in human fetal heart tissue
units.text: we performed ISL1 immunostaining in human fetal heart tissue to verify this finding. This revealed that epicardial cells were indeed positive for ISL1 at 5 weeks after conception, but expression was lost by 6 weeks (Fig. 4d).
units.rationale: This is a protocol step for validating species-specific expression dynamics using immunostaining on tissue samples.
